meanings.definition: Capable of being cheated or deceived.
meanings.sent1: The test was cheatable, so many students cheated.
meanings.sent2: She knew the game was cheatable, but she played fair.
meanings.sent3: The cheatable puzzle tricked him into thinking it was easy.
meanings.sent4: Her cheatable smile hid her true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The cheatable contract led to many disputes.

meanings.definition: Able to be cheated or deceived.
meanings.sent1: The cheatable salesman convinced many to buy his faulty products.
meanings.sent2: He was wary of the cheatable offer and decided not to take it.
meanings.sent3: The cheatable magic trick amazed the audience with its deception.
meanings.sent4: The cheatable appearance of the painting fooled art experts.
meanings.sent5: The cheatable promise turned out to be too good to be true.

meanings.sent1: The cheatable student fell for the teacher's trick questions.
meanings.sent2: The cheatable system was easily manipulated by hackers.
meanings.sent3: His cheatable trust in strangers often led to trouble.
meanings.sent4: The cheatable security measures failed to protect the data.
meanings.sent5: The cheatable nature of the game made it challenging to win.
